CatDescriptText: Marie Trohaugh, housewife, 86 Duncan Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 27, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that newspapers influence public opinion as much today as they did in past? Do you believe that they are 'free' to tell the truth, or do factors like advertising, politics, friendships, etc., influence coverage and presentation?"  Answer reads: "I think so.  Also, I believe press coverage and news presentation are influence to a certain extent but not to a high degree."
TitMainTitle: Marie Trohaugh wearing dark flecked jacket with collar, breast pockets, and light colored buttons, carrying paper shopping bag and dark square handbag, standing next to young girl wearing light colored gingham shirt with rick-rack trim on collar and cuffs, standing in front of store window displaying bottles and pottery on dark fabric with cafe curtain, reflection of buildings and signs in window
